analyzed: shi nas kyang las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //

original: gal te mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na las de dang rgyu mthun par de rtag par shin tu bde zhing bzhon pa dang / skyed mos tshal phun sum tshogs la /üîΩskye bo kun dga' ba'i rgyal po'am /
analyzed: gal te mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na las de dang rgyu mthun par de rtag par shin tu bde zhing bzhon pa dang / skyed mos tshal phun sum tshogs la / skye bo kun dga' ba'i rgyal po'am /
translated: If, with the likelihood of a sea turtle poking its head through a yoke floating on the ocean, they should be born with the general lot in life of a human, they will, in accordance with their causal actions, always be very happy and ride on vehicles.üîΩThey will have perfect parks

original: blon po chen por 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: blon po chen por 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: and become kings or great ministers who are loved by everyone.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas @250b la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas @250b la rtog par byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúNext, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the realm of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will see

original: lha rnams kyi gnas nor bu snying po zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi gnas nor bu snying po zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //

original: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /

original: skyes bu dge ba phan par 'dod pa gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa mi byed la gzhan byed pa'ang phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: skyes bu dge ba phan par 'dod pa gang gis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa mi byed la gzhan byed pa'ang phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: The virtuous person who wishes to benefit others does not kill or steal, and he also causes others to desist from killing and stealing.

original: dge ba'i lam la rab tu 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i lam la rab tu 'jog pa yin no //

analyzed: bdag nyid kyis srog gcod pa mi byed pa'i rnam pa du yod ce na /

analyzed: 'di la sbrang bu'i sbrang rtsi dang / bung ba'i sbrang rtsi dag las drod gsher las skye ba'i srin bu dag 'byung bar mthong nas /

analyzed: de srog gcod pa'i 'jigs pas sbrang rtsi za bar mi byed cing /

original: gzhan za na'ang phyir zlog par byed la /
analyzed: gzhan za na'ang phyir zlog par byed la /

original: rjes su yi rang bar mi byed /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang bar mi byed /

original: 'di ni sdig pa yin par shes nas spong bar byed de /
analyzed: 'di ni sdig pa yin par shes nas spong bar byed de /

analyzed: de thabs kyis kun kyang 'dri bar mi byed la mig zur tsam gyis kyang lta bar mi byed de /

analyzed: srog gcod pa dang bral ba'i rnam pa ni de dag yin no //

analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang bral ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /

analyzed: 'di la sdom pa blangs pas mchod rten gyi gnas su sangs rgyas la mar me phul ba de'i 'od la'ang rku bar mi byed cing des bdag gi las mi byed /

analyzed: de las sna tsha'ang 'byin par mi byed la phra rab tsam la'ang 'jigs par lta ba yin te /

analyzed: de ltar srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dag spangs @251a *// pa yin no //

analyzed: yang srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa spangs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na / 'di la sbrang bu'am / srog chags ma ko ta 'am /
translated: How does one abandon killing and taking what is not given?üîΩHere, one does not kill flies,

analyzed: nam mkha' la rgyu ba dag gsod par mi byed pa yin te /

analyzed: de dag la 'phral la bsams nas gsod par mi byed la /

analyzed: gzhan gyis bzung ba zhig yod na'ang thar par byed /

analyzed: srog gcod pa byas pa nyes par byas pa'i 'bras bu 'chags par byed /

original: gzhan gyis srog gcod pa byas na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis srog gcod pa byas na /
translated: If others have killed,

analyzed: sdig pa'i 'bras bu sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos su 'grub kyi khyod ma byed cig ces 'doms pa yin te /
translated: one advises them, ‚ÄúDo not do this, for the result of the misdeed is to be reborn in the great hell of Reviving.‚Äù

analyzed: de ltar gzhan yang bzlog nas sdom pa la rab tu 'jog par byed de /

original: de ni sdig pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sdig pa spangs pa yin no //

analyzed: bdag dang / gzhan gyi rgyud tshul khrims la rab tu zhugs pa'i rgyun rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ba ni 'di la dgon pa'am /

analyzed: lam du zhugs pa / lam rgyags nyung yang srog la mi lta bar gzhan lam rgyags nyung ba'am /

analyzed: lam rgyags med pa sdug bsngal ba la srog yongs su btang nas rang gi kha zas bgo bsha' byed pa de ni 'bras bu che ba yin no //
translated: and one‚Äôs provisions are small. But one does not care about one‚Äôs own life. One shares one‚Äôs food with others who have little or no provisions and who are suffering. This is the great result.

analyzed: zhing gi 'bras bu'i khyad par sems pa ni dus su phyin pa dang ldan pa yin te /

analyzed: 'di ltar nad rnams kyi nang na bkres pa nad che ba yin na /

analyzed: de lam bltas par 'bras bu chen por yang dag par sbyor ba yin no //

analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims gnyi ga srung ba bdag @251b dang; gzhan la phan par rab tu zhugs pa /

analyzed: sems rnyog pa med pa drang po'i rang bzhin can /

analyzed: sems can shin tu mi dge ba phra rab tsam la'ang 'jigs par lta ba de / ma dang / pha'i lus la nor bu dag gi rgyan 'dogs pa'am /
translated: who sees the danger in even the slightest nonvirtue,üîΩwill be like a person who adorns the bodies of his mother and father with jewels

analyzed: sangs rgyas la nor bu dag gi rgyan 'bul ba'i mi de lus dang bral nas /

analyzed: gnas gzhan thams cad kyang de'i rab tu gsal ba des de nas yang brgya 'gyur du rab tu gsal bar byed do //

analyzed: mdog sngon po dang / ser po dang / btsod ka dang / dmar po rnams kyis gsal bar byed do //

analyzed: dper na / 'ja'i mdog mjas par 'gyur ba de bas kyang lha'i rang gi lus las 'od byung ba brgya 'gyur gyis mdzes pa yin te /

analyzed: dge ba'i las des mngon par bsgrubs pa'i lus kyi 'ong byung bas lha'i tshogs thams cad zil gyis mnan nas rnam par @252a *//

analyzed: mdzes so // ji lta nyi ma'i 'od kyis gza' dang / skar ma dang / rgyu skar thams cad zil gyis mnan nas rnam par mdzes pa de bzhin du /

analyzed: lha de 'od kyi phreng ba 'bar zhing de rang gi gzi brjid des 'bar ba na rang gi gnas de dag la rtog par byed do //

analyzed: gnas de'ang kun nas nor bu rnam pa sna tshogs kyis nye bar spras shing sna tshogs su brgyan pa /

original: kun nas thams cad du rnam par mdzes pa yin te /
analyzed: kun nas thams cad du rnam par mdzes pa yin te /

original: nyi ma brgya lta bur 'od 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: nyi ma brgya lta bur 'od 'byung ba yin no //

original: des de dag mthong nas yid rab tu dga' bas phyogs gnyis pa la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: des de dag mthong nas yid rab tu dga' bas phyogs gnyis pa la rtog par byed de /

analyzed: de na lha mo gzugs bzang mo dang ldan pa /

analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyu rnam pa sna tshogs skyed pa sten pa dag mthong ste / 'di lta ste /

translated: There are many ways to please the minds of all beings.

translated: When he is born there and sees those goddesses, first of all he is seized by the five sense pleasures that are like the fangs of the snake of desire.

analyzed: stan de las langs nas gzhan du 'gro ste /

translated: When he sees the goddesses with incomparable beauty, wearing divine garlands and clothes, with his mind tormented by the fire of desire he goes to them and they also go to the god.

analyzed: de nas lha'i bu gzhan de 'chi ba na yongs su gtong bar byed de /

translated: Just as bees leave a withered flower and go to a fresh flower, so the goddesses leave the dying god and go to the other god.

analyzed: me tog sar pa lta bu'i lha'i bu gzhan gyi drung du 'gro bar byed la /

original: me tog sna tshogs kyi phreng ba thogs pa snying du sdug cing chags pa /
analyzed: me tog sna tshogs kyi phreng ba thogs pa snying du sdug cing chags pa /

original: lha'i bu gzhon nu dang thams cad du 'dris pa /
analyzed: lha'i bu gzhon nu dang thams cad du 'dris pa /

original: ji ltar sems can dmyal ba mnar med pa'i mes mnar med pa'i lus bsregs pa de ltar de'i sdug pa gzhan du dong bar gyur pa'i yid la 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal gyi yid @253a *//
analyzed: ji ltar sems can dmyal ba mnar med pa'i mes mnar med pa'i lus bsregs pa de ltar de'i sdug pa gzhan du dong bar gyur pa'i yid la 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal gyi yid @253a *//
translated: Just as the body in the Avƒ´ci hell is tormented by the fire of Avƒ´ci, so his mind is tormented by the suffering of death, thinking, ‚ÄúMy loved ones have gone elsewhere.‚Äù

original: shin tu gdungs pas shin tu gdungs te /
analyzed: shin tu gdungs pas shin tu gdungs te /
translated: He is tormented by the suffering of death.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas nas lha'i bu 'chi ba na phrag dog dang / ser sna'i yid sdug bsngal ba des mngon par nyams pa de 'chi ba'i dus byed do //

translated: When a god in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three dies, he is afflicted by the mental pain of jealousy and stinginess, and he dies in a state of utter ruin.

original: de srid pa phyi mar sems shin tu gdungs pa de la dmigs pa'i nye bar len pa'i rkyen gyi srid pas sems rnyog pa can du byas pa de /
analyzed: de srid pa phyi mar sems shin tu gdungs pa de la dmigs pa'i nye bar len pa'i rkyen gyi srid pas sems rnyog pa can du byas pa de /
translated: In his next life, his mind is tormented by the suffering of the past life, and the condition of appropriation that focuses on that suffering causes his mind to become turbid.

original: de las gzhan yang mi mthong ste /

analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /

original: rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa du yod ce na /

original: gang bdag nyid kyis srog mi gcod pa yin te /üîΩ'di ltar chu srin byis pa gsod @265b dam; kum bhi ra'am; na kra'am /
analyzed: gang bdag nyid kyis srog mi gcod pa yin te / 'di ltar chu srin byis pa gsod @265b dam; kum bhi ra'am; na kra'am /

original: shang ka chu 'gram du bzung ste /
analyzed: shang ka chu 'gram du bzung ste /
translated: For example, there are those who catch and bind a makara, a kumbhira, or a nakra on the banks of a river.

analyzed: bcings nas gson bzhin du sha gtogs nas za ba'am /

analyzed: phyir bzlog nas dge ba'i lam la rab tu 'jog par byed pa yin te /

analyzed: rnam pa de dag ni srog gcod pa spangs pa yin no //

analyzed: ma byin par len pa spangs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /

original: 'di la skyes bu dge ba dad pa dang ldan par gyur pa /
analyzed: 'di la skyes bu dge ba dad pa dang ldan par gyur pa /

translated: He has taken vows and is free from thoughts of attachment.üîΩHe does not smell the incense that is offered to the sa·πÖgha

analyzed: mchod rten la bdug spos phul ba de la de sdom pa'i bsam pas snom par mi byed /

analyzed: dri zhim po des gos la gos par mi byed /

original: myong bar mi byed /
analyzed: myong bar mi byed /

analyzed: sna'i yul dang phrad kyang mi 'dod pa yin te /

original: rnam pa de dag yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag yin no //

analyzed: gzhan yang; ma byin pa len pa shin tu chung ba'ang mi len la /

analyzed: me tog de dag gi dri shin tu zhim pa kun tu dpag tshad tsam du 'byung la /

analyzed: kha dog sngon po dang / ser po dang / brtsod ka dang / dkar @266b po rnams kun nas shin tu rnam par phye ba yin no //

original: ji ltar mi'i 'jig rten na ri mo mkhan shin tu mkhas pa /
analyzed: ji ltar mi'i 'jig rten na ri mo mkhan shin tu mkhas pa /
translated: Just as in the human world, a very skilled painter

analyzed: legs par bslabs pa byang zhing mkhas pa'i las kyis gnas dang / gnas dag tu phreng ba shin tu sdug par bris pa de ltar shing la rnam par 'byung bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: shing de rnams las phun sum tshogs pa de lta bu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Such perfection arises from those trees.

analyzed: de nas yang rnam pa gzhan gyis lha de rnams yul gyi bde ba lnga myong bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: sil snyan yan lag lnga dang yang dag par ldan pa rnams tshal dang nye ba'i tshal du rtse bar byed /

analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed do; ;'dod pa thams cad yang dag par 'byor ba des /

analyzed: las legs par byas pa des lha rnams kyi thams cad yang dag par 'grub bo //

analyzed: de nas bde ba gzhan dang yang dag par ldan par 'gyur te /

analyzed: rdzing me tog sna tshogs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yod la de'i mthu 'di lta bu 'byung ste / 'di lta ste /

analyzed: me tog kha phye ba zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //

original: de nam yang zhum par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nam yang zhum par mi 'gyur la /

analyzed: der lha mo de rnams shin tu dga' ba skyed de /

analyzed: kye; ae ma bung ba sna tshogs dag shin tu nyams @267a *//
translated: ‚ÄúOh! The various bees are so delightful!

original: dga' bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: dga' bar byed pa yin la /

original: bdag cag gi snying la'ang rab tu sim pa 'byung ngo zhes phan tshun smra ste /
analyzed: bdag cag gi snying la'ang rab tu sim pa 'byung ngo zhes phan tshun smra ste /

analyzed: de ltar de srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: This is how he abandons killing and stealing.

original: mi dge ba la zhugs pa dge ba la rab tu 'jug pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba la zhugs pa dge ba la rab tu 'jug pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How does one who is engaged in nonvirtue become engaged in virtue?

original: 'di la skyes bu dam pa legs par spyod cing dge ba spyod pa rtag tu bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la phan par byed pa /
analyzed: 'di la skyes bu dam pa legs par spyod cing dge ba spyod pa rtag tu bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la phan par byed pa /
translated: Here a holy person who is engaged in good conduct and virtue is always working for his own benefit and the benefit of others.

original: 'byor pa nyung bar gyur pa /
analyzed: 'byor pa nyung bar gyur pa /
translated: He may have few resources.

original: tshegs chen pos 'tsho ba /
analyzed: tshegs chen pos 'tsho ba /
translated: He may have to struggle to make a living.üîΩHe may have to struggle to obtain resources.

original: tshegs chen pos 'byor ba dag sbyin pa po dang / sbyin pa bdag gi drung du 'dug ste /
analyzed: tshegs chen pos 'byor ba dag sbyin pa po dang / sbyin pa bdag gi drung du 'dug ste /
translated: He sits in the presence of donors and patrons

original: de dag la slob par byed /üîΩsbyin pa'i 'bras bu dag kyang shes la /
analyzed: de dag la slob par byed / sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dag kyang shes la /
translated: and teaches them.üîΩHe knows the results of generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu de kun tu ro myang bar byed /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu de kun tu ro myang bar byed /
translated: He experiences the results of generosity.

original: kun tu myangs nas kyang yang dang / yang du mgon med cing nyon mongs sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: kun tu myangs nas kyang yang dang / yang du mgon med cing nyon mongs sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: Having experienced them completely, he gives again and again to those who are helpless and who suffer from the suffering of defilement.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa thob pa'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa thob pa'am /
translated: Or he gives to those who have obtained the third meditation,

original: de dang mthun pa'am /
analyzed: de dang mthun pa'am /
translated: or to those who are similar to them,

original: de la zhugs pa la sbyin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de la zhugs pa la sbyin par byed pa yin te /
translated: or to those who are engaged in the path to them.

original: de ni legs par byas pa'i las kyi mtha' spyad pa rnams kyis chos dang mthun pa'i longs spyod bsgrubs nas de gsum gyis sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: de ni legs par byas pa'i las kyi mtha' spyad pa rnams kyis chos dang mthun pa'i longs spyod bsgrubs nas de gsum gyis sbyin par byed do //
translated: This is giving by those who have practiced good actions, having acquired wealth in accordance with the Dharma, and then given it to these three.

original: gsum ni gang gi tshe sbyin pa sbyin par bya'o snyam du sems pa de'i tshe las kyi nyer bsdogs yin no //
analyzed: gsum ni gang gi tshe sbyin pa sbyin par bya'o snyam du sems pa de'i tshe las kyi nyer bsdogs yin no //
translated: The three are the preparatory action of the action when one thinks, ‚ÄúI will give a gift.‚Äù

original: gang sbyin par byed pa de las yin no //
analyzed: gang sbyin par byed pa de las yin no //
translated: The action itself is when one gives.

original: gang gi tshe byin nas yid kyis ro myang bar byed cing de ltar yid la sems pa de'i tshe las kyi mjug @289b yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe byin nas yid kyis ro myang bar byed cing de ltar yid la sems pa de'i tshe las kyi mjug @289b yin no //
translated: The concluding action is when, after giving, one savors the experience of giving and thinks about it.

original: de ltar dge ba stong nyis brgya bya ba byas pa de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten zhib tu spyod pa'i gnas su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dge ba stong nyis brgya bya ba byas pa de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten zhib tu spyod pa'i gnas su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving engaged in these twelve hundred virtuous acts, when they later separate from their bodies, they will go to the joyous higher realms and be born among the gods in the realm of Thoroughly Enjoying Themselves.

original: der skyes nas kyang dge ba'i las kyi mtha' spyad pa de las zhib mo des yid la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin bdag nyid kyi ngo bo che ba'am /
analyzed: der skyes nas kyang dge ba'i las kyi mtha' spyad pa de las zhib mo des yid la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin bdag nyid kyi ngo bo che ba'am /
translated: ‚ÄúOnce born there, they will experience the effects of their virtuous actions. Due to their refined actions, they will be able to assume a body of any size they wish.

original: chung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They can be big or small.

original: lha'i gnas de dag kyang rin po che sna bdun gyi shing ljon pa rnams mdog shin tu gsal zhing rang gi dge ba'i las kyis dri ma med pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i gnas de dag kyang rin po che sna bdun gyi shing ljon pa rnams mdog shin tu gsal zhing rang gi dge ba'i las kyis dri ma med pa yin no //
translated: The divine realm is filled with trees made of the seven precious substances, which are extremely colorful and immaculate due to their own virtuous actions.

original: tshal de'ang srid du dpag tshad nyi shu la zheng du dpag tshad bcu yod de /
analyzed: tshal de'ang srid du dpag tshad nyi shu la zheng du dpag tshad bcu yod de /
translated: The forest is twenty leagues long and ten leagues wide.

original: chu bo dang / 'bab chu dang / lteng ka dang / tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal dang / nang gi tshal rnams kyis shin tu gang ba shin tu blta na sdug pa yin la /
analyzed: chu bo dang / 'bab chu dang / lteng ka dang / tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal dang / nang gi tshal rnams kyis shin tu gang ba shin tu blta na sdug pa yin la /
translated: It is filled with rivers, waterfalls, ponds, forests, parks, and inner parks, and it is extremely beautiful.

original: shing ljon pa rnams kyis tshal gang yin pa 'di dri ma med pa dang / gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: shing ljon pa rnams kyis tshal gang yin pa 'di dri ma med pa dang / gsal ba yin te /
translated: This forest is pure and clear, for it is filled with trees.
